Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a string telephone accurately showing two cups connected by a string.
The student can clearly illustrate how the device uses sound to send or receive information, possibly by including vibration lines or arrows showing sound waves traveling through the string.
The student can meticulously show only the materials provided for creating such a device, such as paper cups and string.
The student can illustrate key features like sound traveling via the string, using appropriate arrows or labels.
The student can demonstrate in their drawing that the device effectively solves the problem of communication over a distance, possibly with additional notes or visual cues.
The student can depict why this communication device is helpful to people, such as by showing the distance between the students and indicating that they are far apart but still communicating.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details, such as forgetting to label one of the cups, though this doesn't hinder understanding.
The student might neglect to depict environmental effects that could affect sound transmission (e.g., slack in the string), but it is unlikely that this misunderstanding occurs at this level.
